wikipedia_page.main: Arthur James Grant (21 June 1862 – 24 May 1948) was an English historian.

response: * Arthur James Grant (1862–1948) historianUK National Archives, Archival material relating to Arthur James Grant retrieved 19 January 2018

link_mentions.page: List of English translations from medieval sources: C
response: *Early lives of Charlemagne (1922).Einhard, 7., Notker, B., Grant, A. J. (Arthur James). (1922). Early lives of Charlemagne. London: Chatto & Windus. Translations of two biographies of Charlemagne: (1) Vita Karoli Magni by Eginhard [Einhard]; and (2) Gesta Caroli Magni by Notker Balbulus, the Monk of Saint Gall. The latter is not really a biography, but rather a collection of anecdotes of Charlemagne and his family. Translated and edited by Arthur James Grant (1862–1948).
